transcript.text: Hello everyone, welcome to NISO Academy. In the previous lecture we understood friend classes. We got to know that we can define a class that can access private and protected members of some other class. We call that class the friend class of the other class. Now in this presentation we will understand the concept of friend member functions. So we started with this lecture and let's see what are the topics. There is only one topic and the name of the topic is friend member functions. Now let's understand what are friend member functions. A friend member function is a member function that can access private and protected members of some other class. First of all it is a member function of some class and it can access private and protected members of the other class. That is why it is called friend member function. Also it is useful when we don't want the entire class to have access. We know that when we define a friend class then the entire class have access to the private and protected members of the other class. But what if we want that only the specific member functions of the class should be able to access private and protected members of the other class. If we want this then we should not define the class as friend class. Instead we can define some member functions, the friend member functions. In this way we will allow access to the private and protected members of the other class to some member functions only. Not all the member functions of the class. I hope this idea is clear to you. Now to make this more clear let's take the same example program we took in the last lecture. Here is the example program we have understood in the last lecture. Here we have the class diary which mimics the real life diary that allows us to set the secret message via this function set secret. Through this function we can provide some string to this variable secret which is the private member of this class. Here we have defined the class best friend which mimics the best friend and this class can access the private member secret and here through this read secret function we can read the secret message. This is what we can observe and this is what we saw in the last lecture as well. And this is possible because this class is defined as the friend class of this class. That is why it can access private and protected members of this class diary. Therefore in this member function we can access the private member secret. Now if we want this then we should not define this class as the friend class of this class. Instead we should define this function as the friend function. I hope this makes sense to you. This is what I have mentioned here. Friend member functions are useful when we don't want the entire class to have access. Here we do not want this function to have access to the private member secret. For this purpose we only define this function as the friend function of this class. Now how we can do this. This can be done by replacing this line with this line. Here I am mentioning that read secret is the function which is the member function of the class best friend and I am doing this with the help of scope resolution operator. This is the declaration of the read secret function and its return type is void. Here I am using the keyword friend to declare it as the friend function of this class. Now this function can access the private member of this class. No other function of this class can access this private member. I hope this idea is clear to you. Now it seems like this program will work as expected just like before and we will get the output on the screen. But here we will get error from the compiler. Now you might be thinking why are we getting error here. We are doing everything right. We have made this member function the friend function of this class. Now this function can access the variable secret and this function is not using the secret variable. Therefore we should not get error from the compiler but we are getting error and we are getting error because of the read secret function. This function is currently not visible to the compiler. I mean to say that the definition of this function is not visible to the compiler at this point. This is because compiler reads the code from top to bottom and when it encounters this line it will throw the error because the definition of this function is not available before this declaration. Its definition is available after its declaration that is over here in this class. This is the problem. Now to resolve this problem we want this class. We can do this by bringing this class to the top and by bringing this class to the bottom. That is we need to shift the order of these classes. Here is how we can shift the order. Now we have the class best friend at the top and the class diary at the bottom. The code is exactly the same. We have just changed the order. Now there will be no problem. When compiler read the code it will read the code from top to bottom and it will encounter the definition of the read secret function first. Now compiler will not throw the error because of read secret function but again when we execute this program we will get error from the compiler. Now why are we getting error this time? This means this is the object of class diary but the definition of the class diary is available over here and there is no declaration of this class before this usage.
